## **Topic 3. Protocols and Reference Models Study Guide Instructor**

- 1. Describe in one sentence the flow control. (2) **(S8)**
  - **Manages the rate of data transmission and defines how much information can be sent and the speed at which it can be delivered.**
- 2. What term is used for each of the following: (3) **(S9)**

| Communication from one-to-many recipients     | Multicast |
|-----------------------------------------------|-----------|
| Communication<br>from one-to-allrecipients    | Broadcast |
| Communication<br>from one-to-one<br>recipient | Unicast   |

3. Briefly describe the functions of the Layers of the OSI Model: (14) **(S25)**

| # | OSI Model Layer | Description                                                                                       |
|---|-----------------|---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| 7 | Application     | Contains protocols used for process-to-process communications                                     |
| 6 | Presentation    | Provides for common representation of the data transferred between<br>application layer services. |
| 5 | Session         | Provides services to the presentation layer and to manage data<br>exchange.                       |
| 4 | Transport       | Defines services to segment, transfer, and reassemble the data for<br>individual communications.  |
| 3 | Network         | Provides services to exchange the individual pieces of data over the<br>network.                  |
| 2 | Data Link       | Describes methods for exchanging data frames over a common<br>media.                              |
| 1 | Physical        | Describes the means to activate, maintain, and de-activate physical<br>connections.               |

4. Describe the function of the protocol layers of the TCP/IP Protocol Model. (8) **(S26)**

| TCP/IP Model<br>Layer | Description                                                                |
|-----------------------|----------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| Application           | Represents data to the user, plus encoding and dialog control.             |
| Transport             | Supports communication between various devices across diverse<br>networks. |
| Internet              | Determines the best path through the network.                              |
| Network Access        | Controls the hardware devices and media that make up the<br>network.       |

- 6. What is data encapsulation? (6) **(S6, S31, S32)**
  - **It's a top down process of placing one message format where protocols add their information to the data (the letter) inside another message format (the envelope) and is repeated by each layer.**

| OSI Protocol Stack | PDUs    |
|--------------------|---------|
| Upper Layers       | Data    |
| Transport          | Segment |

8. What is the role of the following types of addresses? (4) **(S34)**

| Address Type                 | Role/Responsibility                                                                                                            |
|------------------------------|--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| Network layer addresses      | Responsible for delivering the IP packet from original source<br>to<br>the final destination.                                  |
| Data Link<br>layer addresses | Responsible for delivering the data link frame from one<br>network interface card (NIC) to another NIC on the same<br>network. |

- 9. What addresses are contained in the IP packet header? (2) (**S35)**
  - **a. Source IP address.**
  - **b. Destination IP address.**
- 10. What addresses are contained in the Ethernet Frame Header? (2) (**S36)**
  - **a. The Source MAC address.**
  - **b. The Destination MAC address.**
- 11. What is the purpose of the Default Gateway? (4) (**S38)**
  - **The default gateway (DGW) is the "door" or "gateway" to all other remote locations and has an IP address that is part of the local LAN.**
- 12. When is an Ethernet Frame sent to the Default Gateway? **(S38)**
  - **When the final destination is remote, the data link frame will use the MAC address of the default gateway.**

- 14. What is the address of the default gateway (DGW)? (S38)
  - **The IP address of the DGW is the IP address of the router interface connected to the local LAN.**
- 15. What happens if a device does not have the default gateway address configured? (S38)
  - **All devices on the LAN must be told about this address or their traffic will be confined to the LAN only.**
